title: Al-Biruni
summary: Abu Rayhan al-Biruni /ælbɪˈruːni/ (973 – after 1050)[6] was an Iranian[7][8][9][10] scholar and polymath during the Islamic Golden Age. He has been called variously the "founder of Indology", "Father of Comparative Religion",[11][9][12][13] "Father of modern geodesy", and the first anthropologist.[14][15]
